definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Jean-Jacques Rousseau also noticed that private property makes man alienate.
sentences.chinese: 盧梭也看到了私有制使人產生異化。

sentences.english: The revolution would abolish as well the institutions of private ownership.
sentences.chinese: 這場革命還廢除了私有制。

sentences.english: Is operating more than one kinds of private ownership of firms.
sentences.chinese: 是一家多種經營的私有制企業。

sentences.english: The economic system of the United States is principally one of private ownership.
sentences.chinese: 美國的經濟體制主要是一種私有制。

sentences.english: In China, only the young had not experienced private agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，只有年輕農民未曾經歷過私有制農業。

sentences.english: Return to say "half public half to private ownership".
sentences.chinese: 回到要講的“半公有半私有制”方面來。

definition: ownership of the means of production (in Marxism)/system of ownership
relations between levels of production/socio-economic relations
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
natural economy (exchange of goods by bartering not involving money)
to nationalize/to take over as communal property
